Description: Decorated wooden lintel bearing a Coptic inscription. Symmetrical decoration consists of a central cross within a wreath flanked by nomina sacra and Coptic text, and, at the far ends, facing cockrels.
Curator's comments: Cf. Musée du Louvre E16985 (Bénazeth 2002, no. 20) Permission to publish her own photograph of this object granted to Dr Elisabeth Enss in email 26/3/04. To be published in her thesis on Late Antique Egyptian woodcarving from Ludwig Reichart-Verlag, Wiesbaden. [NCS] Published: E Enss, Holzschnitzereien der spatantiken bis fruhislamischen Zeit aus Agypten: Funktion und Dekor (Wiesbaden 2005), 111, pls. 24-25 (no. 21).
Bibliographic references: Enss 2005 / Holzschnitzereien der spätantiken bis frühislamischen Zeit aus Ägypten: Funktion und Dekor (no. 21 (p.111, pls. 24-25)) (M. Krause suggests Bawit, based on inscription)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Archangel Gabriel (right side)
Named in inscription: Mena (father, right side)
Named in inscription: Shenoute (Deacon, left side)
Named in inscription: Daniel (father, left side)
